location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Morley, East India Company Resident at Bushire, and his assistant, George Green, to Henry Moore, East India Company Agent at Bussora [Basra]

mods.abstract: The letter is an adjunct to the previous letter [IOR/R/15/1/1, ff 147v-148] in response to a letter received from the Basra Agency. It explains the decision to pay for an express boat to deliver a packet to Bombay, claiming that it was George Skipp, in Shiraz, who deemed it necessary.
